programme.title: The Lego Ninjago Movie (2017)
programme.desc: Shunned by everyone for being the son of an evil warlord, a teenager seeks to defeat him with the help of his fellow ninjas

programme.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey - Extended Cut (2012)
programme.desc: A reluctant Hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, sets out to the Lonely Mountain with a spirited group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home, and the gold within it from the dragon Smaug

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug - Extended Cut (2013)
programme.desc: The dwarves, along with Bilbo Baggins and Gandalf the Grey, continue their quest to reclaim Erebor, their homeland, from Smaug. Bilbo Baggins is in possession of a mysterious and magical ring

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies - Extended Cut (2014)
programme.desc: Bilbo and company are forced to engage in a war against an array of combatants and keep the Lonely Mountain from falling into the hands of a rising darkness

programme.title: Jojo Rabbit (2019)
programme.desc: A young boy in Hitler's army finds out his mother is hiding a Jewish girl in their home

programme.title: To Be Decided
programme.desc: Random TV shows, music and movies

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Daily Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt and Jack Monroe are joined by a range of culinary talent from across the country by live link as they cook up another selection of dishes to inspire viewers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The development of a commercial property in Ebbw Vale in Blaenau Gwent, as well as semi-detached houses in Lower Gornal in the West Midlands and Gillingham in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A truck driver is diverted along a narrow road that cannot cope with the weight of his vehicle, with disastrous consequences. Paramedics treat an unresponsive baby.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross is joined by experts Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon at the Kent County Showground in Detling and pays a visit to the Historic Docks RNLI museum in Chatham.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A couple get home after a night out but something does not feel right about the house. They fear there is a burglar upstairs. Ex-EastEnder Kellie Shirley (Carly Wicks) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Convicted killer Violet is given a temporary reprieve from the gallows, and begs Father Brown to help prove her innocence. However, with only three days in which to do it, he must try to find the real culprit before it's too late. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple with a budget of Â£450,000 search for a rural retreat in West Wales. Whilst in the area, Jules also visits Lammas, Britain's first eco-village.(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: Consumers test and score a dog-training tool, vegan nail varnish and a T-shirt for children that can be coloured-in, while the makers watch on. Presented by Lucy Alexander.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus Daily Update: BBC News Special
The Big Night In
programme.desc: Comic Relief and Children in Need come together for the first time to present an evening of entertainment the like of which has rarely been seen before, while raising funds for those on the frontline fighting Covid-19, as well as unsung heroes going the extra mile to support their communities during these unprecedented times. Lenny Henry and Matt Baker come together (while staying safely apart) to host the event, with help from Zoe Ball and Paddy McGuinness. Stars entertaining from the comfort of their homes include Gary Barlow, Peter Kay and Catherine Tate, and the stars of Strictly try to get viewers dancing around their living room. There'll also be some of the greatest comedy sketches of all time, as voted for by viewers, some incredible money-can't-buy prizes throughout the course of the evening.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus: Clap For Our Carers
programme.desc: Live coverage as people around the UK applaud health service workers battling the coronavirus pandemic.(n)

programme.title: The Big Night In
programme.desc: The evening of comedy, music and entertainment continues, as celebrity performers are beamed directly from their homes into those of the viewers in a bid to raise funds for those fighting the coronavirus pandemic. Presented by Lenny Henry, Matt Baker, Zoe Ball and Paddy McGuinness.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Sasha is occupied with a training course, the boys' investigations take them to a lookalike agency, where their top two acts were found dead in an apparent double suicide 13 years ago. In an industry reliant on the art of the illusion and their suspects intent on giving them the run around, Ted, Steve and Danny are convinced there's more to this case than first meets the eye. Steve is thrilled when their enquiries take them to the door of one of his football heroes, but his glee is short-lived. Detective drama, starring Denis Lawson.(n)

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Adam Fleming, Laura Kuenssberg and Fergus Walsh discuss the latest on the coronavirus crisis.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Daily Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt and Jack Monroe are joined by culinary talent from across the country by live link, demonstrating a range of dishes to inspire the audience.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell checks out a three-bedroom semi in Alvaston, Derby, and a basement flat in Blackpool. Dion Dublin meets the developer who bought a Liverpool terrace.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: The couple whose car was hit by a truck on the M1 while on a journey to celebrate their wedding anniversary. Plus, the wing suit free-fall enthusiast who hit trouble when his main parachute became tangled up, 30 seconds from the ground. Presented by Nick Knowles.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Danny Sebastian and Caroline Hawley help two teams look for items at an antiques centre in King's Lynn, Norfolk, while presenter Eric Knowles visits the former home of world-renowned naturalist Sir Peter Scott.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: On the first day of Ramadan, Ruhma encounters a face from the past who is supposed to help her with her future. Bear tries to get the team members on their feet, while Zara's best laid plans for Joe leave a bad taste in the mouth.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance of an old friend leads Father Brown and Sid on a quest to find the mythical Lannington Rosary, and an old adversary, seemingly back from the dead, must be trusted to help. Mark Williams stars.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson assists a couple who have a Â£500,000 budget and a dream of leaving their city life in Bristol behind them and finding their perfect country home in Monmouthshire. While in the county, keen archaeologist Jules visits the village of Trellech, where local excavation efforts are unearthing what could be the largest medieval settlement in Wales..(n)

programme.title: The Customer Is Always Right
programme.desc: New products include a unisex t-shirt that repels water-based liquids and kills odour-causing bacteria and a Champagne bottle opener. Presented by Lucy Alexander.(n)

programme.title: Coronavirus Daily Update: BBC News Special
The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Patrick Kielty present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Double Olympic silver medal-winning swimmer Jazz Carlin, former England goalkeeper Rob Green, Wimbledon wheelchair tennis champion Jordanne Whiley and Great Britain athlete Jeanette Kwakye join team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell and host Sue Barker on the quiz.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan and Janey decide to change their dentist and Nick uses Ben's laptop to pursue an e-mail romance with a famous model. First-ever episode of the long-running comedy, starring Robert Lindsay, Zoe Wanamaker and Kris Marshall.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with journalist and broadcaster Emma Barnett and comedian Henning Wehn joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The Bafta-award-winning host is back to review trending news stories, before making online contact with Hollywood star Chris Hemsworth, who chats about new action-thriller Extraction. Phoebe Waller-Bridge discusses the live stream of her Fleabag stage show, while Oscar-nominated star of Withnail and I Richard E Grant and campaigning comedian Joe Lycell also feature.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director looks back over his eventful career in showbusiness, recalling singing on an Irish chat show. Featuring a special appearance by comedian and presenter Paddy McGuinness.(n)

programme.title: Kevin Bridges: The Brand New Tour
programme.desc: A stand-up performance filmed as part of Kevin's 2018 UK and Ireland tour and his 19-night residency at the Glasgow Hydro. The comic gives his take on the modern world, social media, anxiety, religion, conversations with his dog and having Barack Obama as his support act.(n)

programme.title: Alan Partridge: Alpha Papa
programme.desc: The hapless local radio DJ ends up in the centre of a crisis when a colleague gets fired by the station's new owners, only to respond by returning to the studio with a shotgun and taking hostages. The police enlist Alan's aid as a negotiator, giving him the chance to revive his own flagging public profile. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan, Colm Meaney and Felicity Montagu.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Presenter Matt Tebbutt is joined by chef Theo Randall, while comedian Mel Giedroyc joins in via video-link. Plus, archive clips from Rick Stein, Keith Floyd and Nigella Lawson.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's Family Favourites
programme.desc: Former Great British Bake Off winner Nadiya Hussain demonstrates dishes ideal for when a flock of hungry faces appear at the door unexpectedly, including radish ceviche with avocado and toasted sourdough, wheat escalopes with hazelnut mash and pink pickled onions, and caramel soda bread tear and share. Nadiya's fascination with fudge takes her to Wiltshire where she meets Jen Gale, while her appreciation for the sour things in life lands her at the Vinegar Shed in London with experts Andy Harris and Angela Clutton.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and a panel of guests discuss the latest football news from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell follow progress on a bungalow in Cabus, Lancashire, and a three-storey house in Newport, Wales.(n)

programme.title: Eliud Kipchoge: My Sub Two Hour Marathon
programme.desc: An interview with the marathon world record-holder, who provides access to his training camp in Kenya, while those closest to him reveal what makes him so special.(n)

programme.title: World Cup Rewind
programme.desc: Guy Mowbray presents a look back at Northern Ireland v Spain from 1982, Brazil v Denmark from 1998 and South Korea v Italy from 2002.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At the recycling centre in Woking, upcycling aficionado EJ Osborne unearths three hidden gems - an unwanted windbreaker, some old workshop cast-offs and a child's chair.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson visits the Peak District with a couple returning from the Netherlands, who want their generous Â£1.5million budget to provide accommodation for their visiting mothers.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: The Rich brothers and Charlie Dimmock travel to Swindon, competing to transform an uninspiring garden into a welcoming and warm outdoor space, perfect for entertaining or dining.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys ushers in another quartet to the black chair to be put to the test on their chosen specialist subjects. Here, the Strictly professional Neil Jones takes on the films of Charlie Chaplin, the musician and presenter YolanDa Brown is quizzed on singer Marvin Gaye, the actor Paul Higgins recalls the Watergate scandal and newsreader Holly Hamilton tackles footballer George Best. The second round sees them tackling general knowledge questions in a bid to carry off the commemorative trophy.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: John Shuttleworth, the Rev Kate Bottley, Robin Askwith, Sue Jenkins, Gyles Brandreth, Baga Chipz, Rachel Yankey and Faye White take part in the general knowledge quiz, in which they try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Catchpoint
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness hosts the family-friendly game show combining physical fun and an exciting question mechanic, as contestants have to think fast as they answer questions while trying to catch balls of various sizes dropped from the studio ceiling, with a variety of entertaining rounds and a cash prize at stake.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An excited Fenisha asks Jan about holiday leave, but her good mood is cut short when she discovers she is pregnant. Connie is called upon to treat a drunk Charlie, who's scraped his head falling over in the park. Realising that Charlie's dramatic exit from the ED following Duffy's death was merely the start of his struggles, Connie encourages the department to keep this as quiet as possible, so as not to embarrass him or tarnish his reputation at the hospital.(n)

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Ben is determined to enter a talent competition at school with an unusual double act, Sue suspects Jake is hiding something, and two unexpected callers complicate matters for the entire family. Comedy, starring Hugh Dennis, Claire Skinner and Daniel Roche.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans drive to Wales for the wedding fayre, and after a momentous trip to the church for the reading of the banns, Nessa tells Stacey her big secret. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Mrs Brown's Boys creator, writer and star Brendan O'Carroll dons Agnes's famous cardigan and curly wig once again as he throws open the doors of the larger-than-life Irish matriarch's home to host the Saturday night chat show. In the sixth and final episode of the series, Agnes and his comical family are joined on the show by chat show host Jonathan Ross, barrister Rob Rinder - along with his mum Angie - and veteran singers the Nolans. Plus, Fleur East performs her latest single live in Foley's.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Alan Shearer and Ian Wright to present the countdown, featuring memorable archive action.(n)

programme.title: Match of Their Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights from three classic Premier League matches, as chosen by some of the regular expert analysts that appear on the show.(n)

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Boston homicide detective Thomas Craven witnesses his activist daughter being brutally murdered outside his home. Believing he was the intended target, Craven sets out to find her killers, but stumbles across a huge political conspiracy reaching to the highest levels of government. Thriller based on the 1985 BBC series, starring Mel Gibson, Ray Winstone, Danny Huston, Bojana Novakovic, Shawn Roberts and David Aaron Baker.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A truck driver is diverted along a narrow road that cannot cope with the weight of his vehicle, with disastrous consequences. Paramedics treat an unresponsive baby.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple from Surrey town to find a new home in the Welsh Borders, and also goes behind the scenes with conservation work at the Slimbridge Wetland Centre.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a bakery that produces 180,000 Cornish pasties a day, and discovers the very specific rule one of the pastries must comply with to genuinely be considered Cornish. Ruth Goodman debunks some myths about pasties and investigates the history of the pepper trade, while Cherry Healey learns about the science of onions - including why cutting them can bring tears to the eyes.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.(n)

programme.title: Curiosity
programme.desc: Martha and Lawrence from Sevenoaks take on Carol and Kath from the West Country in a challenge to curate the most valuable antiques collection. Presented by Paul.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Cookbook
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Simon King travel to the Germanic town of Swakopmund, on the Namibian coast, to experience a traditional barbecue - or braai. To find the right spot among the dunes, the motorcyclists take to the air in a microlight.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Jimmy White v Stephen Hendry. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the 1992 World Championship final, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Caroline Hawley and Michael Baggott find objects at the University of Nottingham to take off to auction. Caroline comes across a jacket worn by Nottingham-born Olympic ice skater Jayne Torvill, and Michael gets excited by a 17th-century Bible that is hiding a secret. Host Paul Martin travels to north Nottinghamshire to visit the Portland Collection, which is one of the largest aristocratic art collections in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Shappi Khorsandi, former newsreader Michael Buerk, actress Amanda Abbington and comedian Elis James take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games. Their scores are tallied from across the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Four groups of dedicated farmers who have shown resilience and ingenuity, go up against each other bidding to win this year's Against the Odds accolade at the Annual British Farming Awards. Narrated by Denis Lawson.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Road to Mexico
programme.desc: The chef retraces a road trip he took in 1968 down the Pacific Coast Highway to the Mexican border and beyond.He begins in San Francisco, the home of sourdough and where America's love affair with seasonal cooking took hold through restaurants like Chez Panisse, run by Alice Waters, who Rick is keen to meet. The chef also reflects on the time he had his first taste of Mexican food.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The latest two highest-scoring South West chefs cook their six-course menus again to impress judges Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The arbitrators are joined by comedian and children's author Nina Wadia, who has a special interest in cuisine for children with diabetes. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The green-fingered team guides team enthusiasts through seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Monty Don and faithful hounds Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow to bring inspiration as well as outline all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend. Co-presenter Rachel de Thame visits stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success.(n)

programme.title: Hubble: The Wonders of Space Revealed
programme.desc: Since its launch in April 1990, the Hubble space telescope has made more than 1.5 million observations of the universe. One of the most productive scientific instruments in history, over the past three decades it has transformed man's view of the cosmos. This documentary tells the craft's remarkable story, drawing upon contributions by the astronauts who spacewalked on Hubble to carry out critical repairs and upgrades and the astronomers who have used its unique powers to make new discoveries about the universe.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: A self-isolated Nish Kumar hosts Britain's most uncompromising topical satire, tackling all the troubling news from a world that's put its faith in Boris Johnson and Donald Trump. His similarly quarantined correspondents, include Ellie Taylor and Steve N Allen.(n)

programme.title: The Mini Mash Report
programme.desc: Nish Kumar and comedy correspondents Rachel Parris, Ellie Taylor and Steve N Allen present the satirical and surreal take on everything that has - and hasn't - happened in the news.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Comprehensive coverage of the day's important national and international news stories.(n)

programme.title: Life of Crime
programme.desc: Two criminals kidnap the wife of a corrupt real-estate tycoon and demand a $1million ransom. However, the businessman is enjoying a holiday in the Bahamas with his mistress and does not want his wife back, setting in motion a complex series of double-crosses. Comedy based on Elmore Leonard's novel The Switch, starring Jennifer Aniston, Mos Def, Isla Fisher and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Four weeks into the Government's lockdown to save lives and protect the NHS, Jane Corbin reports from the frontline to tell the inside story of how a Coventry hospital is coping with Covid-19. She hears from doctors and nurses saving lives and dealing with death every day and asks whether there is enough protective equipment and testing to help protect them from the daily risks to their own health.(n)

programme.title: Cops Like Us
programme.desc: Staffordshire Police officers talk candidly about dealing with domestic abuse. Historically, officers have often treated domestic abuse as a private matter, but now far greater priority is given to investigating reported incidents and safeguarding potential victims. However, this change of approach has sometimes led officers to be called out to resolve petty arguments. The programme also examines the stress of being on permanent standby in the event of riots or terrorist attacks.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood discover some uninvited animal guests, including a herd of elephants in a hotel, and an ant that indulges in some shocking behaviour.(n)

programme.title: All Over the Place
programme.desc: Ed Petrie goes on an offboat road trip across the UK.(n)

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Radio host Mark Wright and CBBC vlogger Lauren Layfield enlist expert designers and builders to construct dream dens for lucky youngsters.(n)

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Blue Peter join Children in Need and Comic Relief for music, dancing and magic!(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall returns to South America to search for more of the planet's deadliest animals. He joins a team trying to save a highly endangered predator, the Orinoco crocodile and witnesses the ferocious maternal instincts of a female croc protecting her nest. In Brazil he heads out for a night-time encounter with a metre long monster of the Amazonian waterways, the wolf fish and back on dry land Steve turns to technology in an attempt to track down one of South America's most elusive jungle predators, the enigmatic Jaguar.(n)

programme.title: Astronauts: Do You Have What It Takes
programme.desc: The candidates move from basic to advanced stages of selection, heading to some of the most specialised astronaut training facilities in Europe. However, they must first overcome a key astronaut selection test - swimming lengths in their flight suits and shoes. Psychologist Dr Iya Whiteley also assesses their attention to detail when faced with an origami test devised by the Japanese Space Agency.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Clare Balding travels to South Africa to join a veterinary team trying to help a rhino called Thandi who was attacked by poachers for her horn. For the first time, a plastic surgeon will attempt a skin graft on the animal to heal the wound. She also visits the rainforest of Borneo to follow the story of an orangutan who needs cataracts removing from her eyes so that she can be released back into the wild. Elsewhere, vet Steve Leonard takes a trip to Chicago's Lincoln Park Zoo, where the latest technology is being used to help chimpanzees with heart disease and visits the South African city of Pretoria, where a Cape fur seal requires a CT scan to identify the root cause of her illness, before witnessing a giraffe being anaesthetised to treat a leg injury.(n)

programme.title: Hugh's Wild West
programme.desc: Dartmoor serves as the next destination of choice for Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, as his trek across the West Country continues. Here, he follows the fortunes of a buzzard family as their sole chick fledges and makes its first moves toward independence. He also tracks salmon as they migrate upstream to breed, and helps marine biologists to survey dolphins off the Devon coast. Plus, efforts to bring water voles back to the region following a 30-year absence, and the work of a local vet who has built up an extraordinary level of trust with an otter family living at the bottom of his garden.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: As the competition continues, chefs Guy Owen, Joe Baker, Thomas Carr and Harriet Mansell compete in the heats for the South West. Each chef prepares a starter and fish course celebrating iconic food from children's literature, including Wind in the Willows, Enid Blyton and Jeremy Fisher.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Susan Calman presents as the South West chefs serve up their mains and desserts inspired by children's literature. They include an ambitious Hogwarts Feast honouring Harry Potter, an emergency sandwich inspired by Paddington Bear, and chocolate-shaped hounds along with edible moss to depict Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's Hound of the Baskervilles.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Comfort Food
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare dishes to feed a multitude. Their salmon pie with spinach and hollandaise is a showstopper, while their chocolate and cherry buns make a perfect centrepiece.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Jimmy White v Stephen Hendry. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the 1994 World Championship final, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Fast Girls
programme.desc: A fierce rivalry develops between a talented working class sprinter and the wealthy daughter of a former Olympic medal-winner as they compete on the track. They are forced to settle their differences and work together when they are recruited for the same relay team. Drama, with Lenora Crichlow, Lily James, Rupert Graves and Noel Clarke, who also co-wrote the script.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Joe Lycett welcomes twelve more contestants to the amateur sewer competition. First up, the sewers are challenged to create seemingly straightforward wardrobe staples, and for their pattern challenge, the judges ask them to make a wrap skirt. Finally, the contestants attempt to make their first made-to-measure garment, a tea dress.(n)

programme.title: A Life on Screen
programme.desc: The actress chats about her 40-year career, from her comedy beginnings in theatre through to her successes in TV and film, including receiving a Bafta Fellowship in 2014. Julie talks about how she got international recognition when she won an Oscar nomination starring opposite Michael Caine in 1983 film Educating Rita, and discusses many of her other roles, including Acorn Antiques' Mrs Overall, and her portrayal of politician Mo Mowlam. With contributions by Victoria Wood, Celia Imrie, Rupert Grint, Alan Bleasdale, Willy Russell, Gary Lewis and Hugh Bonneville.(n)

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's next leg begins in Ho Chi Minh City, where he uncovers the traumatic 20th-century history of Vietnam, a country that went from a French colony to a socialist republic. He also braves the city streets on a motorcycle, samples French-Vietnamese fusion food, and tries his hand at the national sport, Da Cau. Moving on to the Annamite Mountains west of Da Nang, Michael joins modern Vietnamese on holiday in a quirky facsimile of a medieval French village. Then, in the tailoring capital of Hoi An, Michael sees how Cham weavers make their distinctive brocade.(n)

programme.title: Becoming Matisse
programme.desc: Documentary profile of the painter who turned his back on 500 years of academic tradition and became the first avant-garde artist of the 20th century. The film uses a combination of animation and interviews with Joachim Pissarro, Genevieve Taillade and the artist's great-granddaughter Sophie Matisse. She tells the tumultuous story of his early life and retraces key places and moments in his biography, including his art school in Paris and the Spanish fishing village where he made his artistic breakthrough.(n)

programme.title: Love & Mercy
programme.desc: Biopic of the Beach Boys' Brian Wilson, following the singer-songwriter at two periods in his life. In the 1960s, he is at his creative peak, but haunted by inner demons that take their toll on his mental health. By the 1980s, he is a broken man dominated by a shady doctor, until a new relationship offers him a chance at recovery. Starring John Cusack, Paul Dano, Paul Giamatti and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: The Borderlands
programme.desc: Two paranormal investigators working for the Vatican are sent to a remote church in the West Country to investigate reports of supernatural activity. They set up a network of cameras in the building, but what they record proves far more terrifying than anyone expected. Found-footage horror, starring Gordon Kennedy and Aidan McArdle.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode continues his alphabetical tour through the BBC's culinary archive, this time selecting recipes and ingredients linked by the letter F. The Hairy Bikers cook a focaccia and Nigel Slater serves roast figs with honey and marsala.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Danny Clarke turn their attention to a bland, rented front-space in Dalkeith, Midlothian, which they hope to transform into a productive and pretty cottage garden.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The green-fingered team guides team enthusiasts through seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Monty Don and faithful hounds Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow to bring inspiration as well as outline all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend. Co-presenter Rachel de Thame visits stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the first edition of a new look for the programme, Anita Rani is on her home patch in east London to discover what lockdown means for Woodberry Wetlands and what the future holds for the animals of Hackney City Farm. At home, she gets stuck into reinvigorating her garden and cooks up a barbecue tandoori. Adam Henson reveals the effects of the pandemic on farming and Tom Heap investigates how a new British land army might work for fruit and veg growers.(n)

programme.title: Beechgrove
programme.desc: Kirsty Wilson is given unique access to the Royal Botanic Gardens in Edinburgh and George allows us unique access to his precious tool shed. Plus, Carole Baxter and Brian Cunningham answer viewers' gardening questions.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The latest two highest-scoring South West chefs cook their six-course menus again to impress judges Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The arbitrators are joined by comedian and children's author Nina Wadia, who has a special interest in cuisine for children with diabetes. Presented by Susan Calman.(n)

programme.title: The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp
programme.desc: A Home Guard officer serving during the Second World War is outraged by the disrespect for tradition shown by younger soldiers. He looks back on his military adventures during the Boer War and First World War, as well as his three great loves. Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburger's satirical drama, starring Roger Livesey, Deborah Kerr, Anton Walbrook and John Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: A journey around some of the most dramatic coastlines in Europe, uncovering the stories behind how these landscapes have shaped history.(n)

programme.title: World Snooker: Crucible Classics
programme.desc: Stephen Hendry v Ronnie O'Sullivan. Hazel Irvine introduces action from the semi-final at the 2002 World Championship, staged at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison come up with virtual reality designs to transform a Halifax couple's 19th-century home. When owner Paula developed MS, it became vital to make the house more wheelchair accessible - but her partner Jeremy also sees an opportunity to give it a stylish new look. Laura's concept makes the most of the views of the garden and uses clever recycling tricks to stretch the budget, while Robert deploys off-the-shelf materials to making the place more accessible.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a soup factory in Wigan that produces 2.5 million cans a day, and follows the production of a tin of vegetable soup from a pea harvest to the eventual dispatch. He also encounters a pressure cooker that stands 27.4 metres tall. Cherry Healey compares the vitamin content of fresh and frozen vegetables, and visits a salt mine in Crewe, while historian Ruth Goodman cooks up a butterted spinach soup using a recipe from a 17th-century cookbook, which is the earliest known reference to soup in English.(n)

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: A journey around the region, examining the challenges currently facing the nations in the area. In the first episode, Simon visits Malta, uncovering the country's reputation for organised crime, before moving on to the southern coast of Italy, where he joins police officers exploring underground tunnels used by crime bosses on the run. Finally, he arrives in Albania and discovers an ancient tradition of revenge where children can pay the price for their parents' actions.(n)

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams embark on the final leg of their journey, heading off on the 4,800 kilometre trek to the finish line in Ushuaia, Argentina, the most southerly city in the world. However, as they prepare to leave the last checkpoint, one of the teams reveals that they have run out of money and will not be completing the challenge. The three remaining pairs rely on different tactics to get ahead, benefiting from risky gambles, lucky opportunities and the kindness of strangers.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.desc: The presenter reports on how southern Spain has become the main gateway for drugs into Europe, leading to violent turf wars between gangs and a government crackdown as the police struggle to regain control of their streets. Stacey goes on aerial patrol with police officers guarding the strip of water between Morocco and Spain, and discovers the extraordinary lengths smugglers will take to evade them, including travelling at 100mph in speedboats during extreme weather conditions.(n)

programme.title: Trigonometry
programme.desc: Gemma, Ray and Kieran's unity is challenged by a sudden tragedy, and a misunderstanding also leads to a showdown. Gemma rushes back to her childhood home in the wake of the shocking turn of events, Kieran suffers a panic attack which calls his future as a paramedic into question, and Ray finds herself faced with a hard decision.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Homemade Show
programme.desc: Rough-and-ready self-made comedy show featuring Scottish comedian Limmy, aka Brian Limond. Limmy feels guilty about accidentally leaving his phone's stopwatch running and has a lifesaving idea that Scotland can give to the world. He is also unhappy about the placement of the letter Q in the alphabet.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The fragile truce between the vampires and Staten Island's werewolves is put to the test, and only a trial by combat can resolve matters. Colin Robinson finds romance with a new co-worker, who can match him for her ability to spread misery. Arj Barker (Flight of the Conchords) guest stars as the leader of the gang's lycanthropic rivals.(n)

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The housemates venture into Manhattan to try and form an alliance with a powerful old friend, who has risen to become the king of the city's vampires. Laszlo dons his most sinister hat for the occasion, despite Nadja's protests that it is cursed, while Guillermo is left feeling unappreciated by his master.(n)

programme.title: Perfect Pianists at the BBC
programme.desc: David Owen Norris trawls through 60 years of BBC archive material to showcase some of the greatest names in the history of the piano. From the groundbreaking studio recitals of Benno Moiseiwitsch, Solomon and Myra Hess in the 1950s, through the legendary concerts of Vladimir Horowitz and Arthur Rubinstein to more recent performances including Alfred Brendel, Mitsuko Uchida and Stephen Hough, David celebrates some of the greatest players in a pianistic tradition that goes back to Franz Liszt in the 19th century.(n)

programme.title: Tunes for Tyrants: Music & Power with Suzy Klein
programme.desc: A exploration of music's crucial political role in the most turbulent years of the 20th century, beginning by looking at the years after the Russian Revolution and the First World War when music was seen as a tool to change society.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Mark Goodier and Simon Parkin host the edition first shown on July 27, featuring performances by Bros, Simple Minds, Kirsty MacColl, the Primitives, Gloria Estefan, Inner City, Simply Red, Sonia and Alice Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the 70s 2
programme.desc: Performances by new wave bands from the BBC archives, including Elvis Costello, the Police, Ian Dury and the Blockheads, Squeeze, Blondie, Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers, the Cars, Patti Smith and Iggy Pop.(n)

programme.title: Queen: Rock the World
programme.desc: Documentary following the band as they recorded their sixth album, News of the World, and made plans for a tour of the US. Back in 1977, broadcaster Bob Harris was granted exclusive access, conducting interviews with all four members, as well as filming them at work in the studio, rehearsing their North American Tour. Until recently, the documentary was never completed and the footage lay unused in the archive. The film is supplemented by footage shot in the summer of 2017 as Brian May and Roger Taylor took Queen back to the US with Adam Lambert as lead singer.(n)

programme.title: Queen: The Legendary 1975 Concert
programme.desc: The rock band in performance at London's Hammersmith Odeon on Christmas Eve in 1975, featuring early singles including Liar, Keep Yourself Alive, Now I'm Here and Bohemian Rhapsody, as well as Brian May showcasing his guitar skills in Brighton Rock.(n)

programme.title: Rod Stewart Live at Hyde Park
programme.desc: A concert by the singer that closed Radio 2's annual Festival in a Day, held in September 2015 in London's Hyde Park. Featuring a selection of hits from his back catalogue including Angel, In a Broken Dream, The Killing of Georgie (Part I and II) as well as Faces classics including Ooh La La and blues standard Rollin' and Tumblin'.(n)

programme.title: Gregory Porter's Popular Voices
programme.desc: The soul and jazz performer examines how early 20th-century blues growlers, such as Bessie Smith, paved the way for the rhyme and flow of hip-hop, how truth became a quest of rock 'n' roll's greatest poets from Woody Guthrie to Gil Scott-Heron, to Lou Reed and Suzanne Vega, and why popular voices including Bob Dylan, Leonard Cohen and Kurt Cobain don't have to be technically perfect to resonate so deeply and stir people's souls. Contributors include Dave Grohl, Suzanne Vega and KRS-One.(n)

programme.title: Tunes for Tyrants: Music & Power with Suzy Klein
programme.desc: A exploration of music's crucial political role in the most turbulent years of the 20th century, beginning by looking at the years after the Russian Revolution and the First World War when music was seen as a tool to change society.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the 70s 2
programme.desc: Performances by new wave bands from the BBC archives, including Elvis Costello, the Police, Ian Dury and the Blockheads, Squeeze, Blondie, Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers, the Cars, Patti Smith and Iggy Pop.(n)

programme.title: The Private Life of..
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits a farm in Dartmoor, Devon, to explore the habits and intelligence of pigs. He assesses the sensitivity of their noses, which enables them to locate buried truffles, as well as make their way round a maze. Jimmy also finds out how piglets choose the right teat from which to feed and whether they can recognise themselves in a mirror.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Tessa Dunlop and Neil Oliver explore the Irish Sea shoreline that fringes the coasts of England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. Tessa goes in search of new experiences and tales from these shores, hitching a ride on a Liverpool tug-boat, crossing the Irish sea on a luxury cruise liner, and seeking out a surviving sister ship of the Titanic.(n)

programme.title: Twin
programme.desc: Frank continues his private investigation into his friend's death, while Ingrid fights a desperate battle to prevent everything from crashing down around her. Both Karin and Alfred are dangerously close to revealing the truth, and Erik seems to be more part of the problem than part of the solution. In Norwegian.(n)

programme.title: Twin
programme.desc: Frank lacks one last piece of evidence to make everything fall into place, and Erik does what he can to prevent him from grasping it. Ingrid settles things with both Alfred and Erik and dares to look ahead for the first time, but Erik has to make a choice. Should he continue to lie or reveal who he really is? In Norwegian.(n)

programme.title: Disco at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances of disco classics by acts including Chic, Rose Royce, Labelle, Gladys Knight and Village People, from shows such as Top of the Pops, The Old Grey Whistle Test and Later with Jools Holland.(n)

programme.title: What a Performance! Pioneers of Popular Entertainment
programme.desc: Frank Skinner and Suzy Klein examine what happened to British entertainment during the Second World War and beyond, as it faced challenges from the US and TV.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Mark Goodier and Simon Parkin host the edition first shown on July 27, featuring performances by Bros, Simple Minds, Kirsty MacColl, the Primitives, Gloria Estefan, Inner City, Simply Red, Sonia and Alice Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Our Musical History
programme.desc: The duo reveal the songs that shaped their respective musical journeys. James picks Tina Turner's epic Proud Mary rendition as one of his all-time greats and Beverley introduces him to Big Mama Thornton - a woman who taught Elvis a thing a two before revealing how she felt when the opportunity to sing with her idol presented itself. Plus, the raw stadium rock vocal of Steve Tyler, the soaring acoustic purity of Eva Cassidy, the intensity of Otis Redding and the passion of Prince. Whitney Houston sings live to an audience of millions, Tom Jones returns to Wales to deliver one of his classic hits and a pitch-perfect George Michael serves to blow the roof off Wembley stadium.(n)

programme.title: Disco at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances of disco classics by acts including Chic, Rose Royce, Labelle, Gladys Knight and Village People, from shows such as Top of the Pops, The Old Grey Whistle Test and Later with Jools Holland.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Tessa Dunlop and Neil Oliver explore the Irish Sea shoreline that fringes the coasts of England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. Tessa goes in search of new experiences and tales from these shores, hitching a ride on a Liverpool tug-boat, crossing the Irish sea on a luxury cruise liner, and seeking out a surviving sister ship of the Titanic.(n)

programme.title: Pubs, Ponds and Power: The Story of the Village
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the history of Cromford in Derbyshire, which was at the heart of 18th-century industrialist Richard Arkwright's mechanised cotton mills and a textile revolution. Ben discovers Cromford became a new kind of village, built to service the enterprise of this powerful man.(n)

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming's exploration of the English canal network continues across the Pennines from Marple to Huddersfield, where his journey is hampered by a fallen tree and a leaking lock pound.(n)

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Exploring the mountains of Dhofar in Oman, where the annual Indian Ocean monsoon has helped create a lost world of waterfalls and cloud forests filled with fascinating wildlife. The programme shows green sea turtles coming ashore in their thousands, shadowed by egg-stealing foxes, as well as footage of striped hyenas doing battle with Arabian wolves. Plus, a glimpse into the lives of chameleons, honey badgers and the elusive Arabian leopard.(n)

programme.title: King Lear
programme.desc: Richard Eyre's adaptation of Shakespeare's tragedy, starring Anthony Hopkins as the ageing monarch who decides to divide his kingdom between his three daughters, only to turn against the youngest and banish her when she refuses to flatter his ego. The remaining sisters are corrupted by their newfound power and drive him into the wastelands, at a terrible cost to his sanity, while the land is plunged into chaos and civil war. With Emma Thompson, Emily Watson, Jim Broadbent, Andrew Scott and Florence Pugh.(n)

programme.title: Get Animated! BBC Introducing Arts
programme.desc: Film critic Ali Plumb celebrates emerging animators making fresh short films, which feature malicious toasters, cheeky Glaswegian pigeons, job-haunting ghosts and smelly fungi.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of British Animation
programme.desc: Documentary exploring animation in the UK from the Victorian era to the present day, taking in the work of Bob Godfrey, John Halas & Joy Batchelor, Len Lye and Aardman Animations, and examining the ingenious methods that low-budget British productions have used to create their own distinctive styles.(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: Buster enlists Binky's help to keep him from gorging on delicious biscuits - will he manage to keep his self-control or will he crumble?(n)

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed
programme.desc: There is a werewolf-type creature on the prowl and suspicion falls on Gnasher.(n)

programme.title: Little Big Awesome
programme.desc: They emerge from the ice to a future where high-waisted trousers have taken over..(n)

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Girl is failing science class, so Mouse offers to help her learn..(n)

programme.title: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: Billy, Emily, Tahj and Jasmine enter Year 9, and on the first day of their return Mark has some big news.(n)

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: When Noah's fate at The Next Step is put to a vote, arguments ensue over what to do.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: The four remaining contenders face the last challenge - creating a tiered, layered show-stopping enchanted woodland-themed cake. Their friends and relatives gather to find out who judges Graham Hornigold and Allegra McEvedy choose to crown Junior Bake Off Champion 2015. Presented by Sam Nixon and Mark Rhodes.(n)

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Naomi Wilkinson introduce clips themed on marriage, including how a porcupine found true love in a zoo, and why a sewer may be a good place to prospect for gold.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: An episode focusing on the life and career of French military leader and ruler Napoleon Bonaparte, following his rise from humble beginnings to being crowned emperor of France. Plus, the programme meets the Indian traveller who brought shampoo to the world. Guest starring Sanjeev Bhaskar.(n)

programme.title: Absolute Genius with Dick & Dom
programme.desc: Richard McCourt and Dominic Wood examine the work of Alan Turing - codebreaker and the man behind the modern-day computer, which the presenters use to put on a fireworks display.(n)

programme.title: Operation Ouch
programme.desc: The doctors learn about sphincters. They also find out what it's like to be a hospital hairdresser when they're faced with cutting real people's hair in Operation Takeover.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: A real-life King Kong shows Steve who is boss, and a scaly thief is caught red-handed..(n)

programme.title: The Pets Factor
programme.desc: James tackles some supersized dental work on retired police horse Hank.(n)

programme.title: Art Ninja
programme.desc: Ricky finds a shop dummy and when he puts a wig on it, he decides it looks a bit like his mate Ella. After a power surge in the flat, the mannequin comes alive.(n)

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Johnson
programme.desc: Drama about a gifted schoolboy footballer, whose parents have recently split forcing him to move house and school. Louis Dunn stars.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Johnson
programme.desc: Drama about a gifted schoolboy footballer, whose parents have recently split forcing him to move house and school. Louis Dunn stars.(n)

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: The team comes to the aid of 12-year-old Will, who had to give up playing rugby to have chemotherapy, but is seeking a place to keep him in the game beyond sitting on the sidelines.(n)

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: The team builds a den for 11-year-old aspiring journalist Soibi, who is finding it hard to write up her reports in the small bedroom she shares with her three-year-old sister.(n)

programme.title: Millie Inbetween
programme.desc: Dad and Mum are separately and enthusiastically planning separate summer holidays for Millie, without taking her feelings into consideration.(n)

programme.title: The Dumping Ground
programme.desc: Visitors gather to watch videos made by Ashdene Lodge residents about their lives there, with the focus turning on Ryan's classic moments. Drama based on books by Jacqueline Wilson, starring Miles Butler-Hughton.(n)

programme.title: Danger Mouse
